text: was a town located in Yūfutsu (Iburi) District, Iburi Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of 2004, the town had an estimated population of 5,267 and a density of 34.07 persons per km². The total area was 154.61 km². On March 27, 2006, Hayakita was merged with the town of Oiwake (also from Yufutsu (Iburi) District) to create the new town of Abira. ==External links== * Abira official website Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hokkaido
title: Hayakita, Hokkaido
